meanings.definition: Cease work or movement in order to relax or recover strength.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of playing outside, the tired dog was resting in the shade.
meanings.sent2: I like to spend my weekends resting at home, watching movies and reading books.
meanings.sent3: The busy bee finally decided to take a break, resting on a colorful flower.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was constantly racing with thoughts until she found peace in resting by the calm lake.
meanings.sent5: The old tree, with its branches reaching out, seemed to be resting after years of standing tall.

meanings.definition: Be placed or supported so as to stay in a specified position.
meanings.sent1: The cup was resting on the edge of the table, ready to be knocked over.
meanings.sent2: The book was resting on the shelf, waiting to be picked up and read.
meanings.sent3: The umbrella was resting against the wall, forgotten by its owner.
meanings.sent4: The boat was resting on the calm waters of the lake, gently swaying with the breeze.
meanings.sent5: The cat was resting on the windowsill, enjoying the warmth of the sun on its fur.

meanings.definition: Remain or be left in a specified condition.
meanings.sent1: The decision was resting on his shoulders, causing him great stress.
meanings.sent2: The responsibility of taking care of the garden now rested on her, as her parents were away.
meanings.sent3: The fate of the lost ring rested in the hands of the honest stranger who found it.
meanings.sent4: The success of the project rested on the collaboration of the entire team.
meanings.sent5: The hopes of the town for a bountiful harvest rested on the weather forecast.
